DataElement.preferredName: Patient Hepatitis B Infection Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response as to whether or not the patient's background regarding a viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus meets the eligibility criteria outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Hepatitis B Infection Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Hepatitis B Infection Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has known active H
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has known active Hepatitis B infection (positive for HBsAg and/or HBcAb) are they negative for HBV DNA and receiving prophylactic antiviral therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has past or resolved hepatitis B infection, does patient have a negative hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) test and a positive anti-HBc (antibody to hepatitis B core antigen) antibody?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had previous or resolved hepatitis B infection (defined as having a negative hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg] test and a positive anti-HBc [antibody to hepatitis B core antigen] antibody test), were HBsAg and anti-HBc tests done within 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of hepatitis B virus (HBV)?

DataElement.changeDescription: 2020-8-40 AQT added for P10398. AK  10221; tmt.
